This change means that we were previously returning the symbol itself, whereas now we don't return any symbol. I'm wondering whether we should always fall back to the symbol itself if there are no references.

I'm not feeling strongly about this, just wanted to discuss it, since it's a minor change from the previous behavior.

Now, the symbol that represents a definition shows the locations of its references, instead of their locations themselves.
In this case, `MainSuite` shows `<no symbol>` because `MainSuite` represents a definition, and no one refers to `MainSuite`.

I am inclined to fall back to the original behaviour in this case and return the definition result. The reason is to avoid confusing messages like "No definition found for MainSuite"

![Screenshot 2019-06-18 at 15 00 59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408093/59684243-e6f11200-91d9-11e9-9684-46697b894b33.png)
